title: TT Changes Coming Apr 3rd
body:
#TL;DR:#

Starting 3rd of April 2018, both Twisted Treeline Normal Blind and Ranked Flex will be having their scheduled queue up-times reduced.
TT Normal Blind will be changing to one night a week and moving to Friday nights.
TT Ranked Flex will be changing to two nights a week and remaining on Saturday and Sunday nights.

----------------

Hi everyone,

Back when we expanded Ranked TT to four nights a week, the queue could easily sustain that many hours of operation with decent matchmaking in most MMR's due to more players engaging with the queue to earn the end of season rewards unique to TT.

The Ranked TT queue was then kept at 4 nights a week to see if engagement with the queue would be maintained after so many players engaged with it seriously for the first time.

But this has not been the case, and most players who played Ranked TT at the end of last year are no longer engaging with the queue. This has led to poor matchmaking and higher queue times for Ranked TT, especially at higher MMR's.

At the same time, many consistent players of TT Normal Blind have either stopped playing TT or moved over to playing mostly TT Ranked Flex. This has helped sustain TT Ranked Flex somewhat and this is partly why we've waited so long to make these changes, but it has massively reduced the quality of games in TT Normal Blind.

To restore the quality of games for both TT Normal and Ranked, we're reducing the number of nights that both queues are available and moving Normal Blind to one of the more popular nights of the week. Specific changes are:

TT Normal Blind:
- No longer available on Tuesday and Wednesday nights
- Now available on Friday nights from 3 PM AEDT to 1 AM AEDT (AEST after March 31st)

TT Ranked Flex:
- No longer available on Thursday and Friday nights
- Still available on Saturday and Sunday nights from 3 PM AEDT to 1 AM AEDT (AEST after March 31st)

These changes will take effect starting next week.

I understand queue health has been very poor lately, and these changes are supposed to help the short term queue health of the mode, and i appreciate that it is now on weekends + Friday rather than Tuesday - Friday when no one could play, an improvement over last year. However i am sure we would all like to see the queue return to a 7 day status and the only way that can happen is if we bring more players into the mode. I believe going straight to cutting queue times is very counterproductive and lazy on riots part. There are so many options to be explored before resorting to this. 

Advertise The Queue!
The amount of times i have heard "when is ranked 3s on" or "i didn't know 3s was ranked" etc. is absurd.. nobody knows when it is on, and there is no indicator to show whether it is ranked or normals before they get into the lobby. Not everyone checks the boards for queue schedules, there needs to be a notification within the client that tells people when Twisted Treeline is active. Maybe even a greyed out icon that when hovered over will display the queue times. Just add something... anything in the client to tell people when TT is up.

Incentivise the players and engage with the community first!
I like the Twisted treeline dedicated victorious chroma last season it was a great idea. But it is not enough. Where are the champion shards from twisted treeline? And we are still yet to see any physical challenger rewards for the top players.
Riot added missions for a reason. Twisted treeline dedicated missions, will give players a reason to try the game mode, and could spark some interest and bring in new players. What about double XP weekends or 3v3 tournaments.

Bots!
I know, I know, another queue is the last thing we want for healthier queue times. However introducing players to twisted treeline from the beginning would help new players gain interest in the mode, too many players reach level 30 without ever seeing the game mode.

Fix the LP for high ELO players!
There is zero incentive, scratch that.. negative incentive for competition amongst high ELO players. When no matter what, they lose more lp than they gain, often gaining 1-15 and losing 30-50 and even in a 3 challenger vs 3 challenger team it was +12 -25 so it is never worth playing against someone unless you have a 90% chance of winning the game. This effect is exaggerated when challenger/master players like Bma start smurfing, and then they get +3 -30 for win/loss vs challenger players.

Fix the game mode!
Honestly, as much as i hate to say it, as fun as twisted treeline is, it is broken. There is such a massive gap between low ELO and high ELO players in the mode. This is mainly due to the meta. Low ELO players just do not know, do not understand, or straight up refuse to learn the meta. People do not understand that twisted treeline is an entirely different mode than summoners rift. Just look at the ladder, there are platinum solo queue players in Diamond/Challenger 3s, and Challenger solo queue players who don't get out of gold 3s. Even Riot players refuse to play the meta.

I would like to see Altars removed and perhaps the health relic replaced by a neutral monster for junglers to fight over along with the slight widening of the map. Or even reduce the starting gold, so that support meta cannot clear as quickly. And not being able to walk to vile maw without being within turret range is pretty dumb. 

I am sure there are many other options, just ask the player base! Create an open forum for rioters and players alike to discuss the mode freely, offer suggestions, communication is key!

The reason I smurf is because it's a waste of time to play on my main during certain parts of the day. My solo experiences go something like this:

- Is Fince/Maximo/Vigilis/Zenith etc trio queueing with each other?

If I don't pop them, then they're in queue for 1-2 hours. 

Ironically, this is also the reason why all of those guys  duo/trio all the time.

In the end, the problem is duo/trios at Master Tier + in particular. I think people should be allowed to play with friends, but unfortunately "healthy queue' and "duo/trio queue at master +" are mutually exclusive.

All these suggestions about 'lowering queue times' is misguided. You can't 'lower the queue times' without considerably destroying the experience of non high elo players. The end result is the destruction of the queue. You can't have a high elo without the pyramid base that is the low elo players.

Sounds good, but is there any way in the client you could notify players that the TT queue is available? I'm sure there are people out there that don't play TT simply because they don't know the queue is available.

There are definitely players who don't know when or if TT is available, even after all these years. Some players only realizing that TT Ranked was available in OCE after ranked rewards were announced last year is proof of that, and it's guaranteed to be the case this year if there are TT specific rewards again.
We used to put messages in the alert ticker (little exclamation point next to Play button) but these can go unnoticed and should be reserved for when issues are occurring so that we don't dilute the importance of the alert ticker tool.

We also tried weekly news posts that also appeared in client which stated TT was "available now". But a lot of players who commented on those posts voiced that they didn't care about TT, and the amount of notice those news posts got decreased quite rapidly. (If the same thing frequently appears in the same spot in the client, you begin to ignore it, same with the alert ticker). Also, the queue did not show a sustained increase in interest after a while of these posts being a regular thing.

We've explored other options such as the gold highlights that used to appear for RGM queues, but it turns out that that would require development work which can't reasonably be prioritized.

Outside of exploring low-effort options like this, it sadly isn't viable to expend a lot of time on big promotions or in-game events solely to get TT more attention.

Getting players' attention about modes that they are hesitant to even look at is quite the challenge, and if they already prefer the other modes then who are we to tell them to play TT instead?

All that being said, in Ocean Week 2016 and 2017 we promoted TT by having two days with double points given for wins in TT. That made A LOT of players try TT. I'd wager that most of those players who tried TT for Ocean Week haven't touched it since.

It's not available in custom games (along with any other old map ever) because simply put, it doesn't function. It has nothing to do with queue health (as far as customs are concerned). Dominion, and Crystal Scar in general would require significant work to update to a point where it was mostly functional again (with all the new code and interfaces etc). Even the RGMs require updates for every single patch made to the game between one appearance and the next to iron out all the bugs and get them back on their feet.

The payoff for Riot just isn't there, to be constantly updating and supporting a gamemode/map that would only ever be used for customs. The payoff wasn't there when the queue was dying, nevermind now. It's just too huge of a resource sink for very little benefit, both for players and for the business.
